reviews.text:
Three star station because this is rather isolated. The area is heavy on industry.
There are homes and shops, they're about ten minutes away. 
Buses are available but, it's off the beaten track a bit so check a timetable.

Small, unmanned, unkempt station. Next to no cover if it rains, and if you are there late a large chunk of the trains will only open one door to stop people getting on. I'd rather walk up to Cosham than use this station,  and in fact have, several times.

reviews.author_name: London Flareon Tokyo Ebisu - Swanslade 恵比寿-スワンズレイド
reviews.text: Hilsea is located in the Hilsea area of Portsmouth, the station is served by Southern and Southwest Trains, with additional services provided by Great Western Railways. Hilsea is among one of my favourite stations, it's clean, most trains stop here, announcements are clear, the station is up to date and the neighbourhood is quiet.

This station, although small, and lacking in facilities, is probably the best station in Hilsea. The area is mainly industrial, with urban conurbations spring up on the periphery of the industrial areas. The station platforms are also quite dangerous, as the width of the platforms are less than the recommended SWT safety width. Can barely walk 2 abreast on the platforms, so on a busy day extra care should be exercised.
Loads of fun and interesting people
